intro: Anguina dicoelosperma, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Anguina dicoelosperma is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
